    • Adding units

    Adding units

    Kyle Baron

    2020-06-04

    units.Rmd

    For continuous data summaries, we can add units to the data summary tables.

    Unit data

    We make a named list with units for each column we are summarizing.

    units <- list(WT = "(kg)", BMI = "(kg/m2)", SCR = "(g/dL)")

    Here we created the list manually; you can also pull this information out of the data specification object.

    Example

    We pass this unit list into the continuous covariate table function

    library(pmtables)

data <- pmtables:::data("id")

pt_cont_long(
  data,
  cols = "BMI,SCR,WT",
  units = units
)
    Variable na Mean Median SDb Min / Max
    All data
    BMI (kg/m2) 160 22.0 22.2 1.84 18.5 / 24.9
    SCR (g/dL) 160 1.36 1.04 0.986 0.710 / 5.59
    WT (kg) 160 70.9 70.2 12.9 43.6 / 97.2

    a subjects with non-missing values

    b standard deviation 

    pt_cont_wide(
  data,
  cols = "WT,BMI,SCR",
  units = units
)
    WT (kg) BMI (kg/m2) SCR (g/dL)
    70.9 (12.9) [160] 22.0 (1.84) [160] 1.36 (0.986) [160]
    summary is: mean (standard deviation) [number non-missng]
